oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Genetic-Based Infectious Disease Resistance As A New Health Management Strategy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Adams, Garry
Templeton, Joe W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Brucella abortus
heritability
genetic analyses
trait
two genes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cattle naturally resistant to Brucella abortus were bred and progeny from five generations of families were used to study the heritability of genes controlling this trait. Back-crossed calves were phenotyped by challenge with B. abortus and the results from genetic analyses indicated that at least two genes control this trait.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 155
